thread.title: 'Tara Palmer-Tomkinson gave me her Chanel diamond ring the first time we met' Holly Willoughby pays tribute to late it girl
thread.title_full: 'Tara Palmer-Tomkinson gave me her Chanel diamond ring the first time we met' Holly Willoughby pays tribute to late it girl

author: Hayley Minn
title: 'Tara Palmer-Tomkinson gave me her Chanel diamond ring the first time we met' Holly Willoughby pays tribute to late it girl
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Holly Willoughby has paid tribute to Tara Palmer-Tomkinson , revealing her "kind and generous" nature. 
The This Morning host told the story of the first time she met the it girl - who tragically died from a brain tumour aged 45 yesterday. 
Speaking on the ITV show, Holly said: "I remember the first time I met her, she just had this childlike nature about her. 
"She came up to me in a restaurant, and said, 'You know my friend! Read More Holly Willoughby and Tara Palmer Tomkinson (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby and Tara Palmer Tomkinson (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby and Tara Palmer Tomkinson (Photo: ITV) 
"And she was talking and gesticulating with her hands, and I noticed this beautiful diamond ring she was wearing, and I was watching it like a magpie. 
"I said it was beautiful, and she said, 'Oh this? It's just a bit of tut from Chanel', and chucked it in my champagne glass, and said, 'It's yours!' 
"I said 'No I can’t take it', but she said, 'If you don’t take it, I'm going to throw it across the restaurant!' 
"So I woke up and had this beautiful ring!" 
Holly also revealed Tara dressed her for a night out, when she was feeling "big and dumpy" having just given birth to her daughter Belle. Read More Holly Willoughby and Tara Palmer Tomkinson (Photo: ITV) Holly Willoughby and Tara Palmer Tomkinson (Photo: ITV) 
She said: "I was still breast-feeding, so feeling big and dumpy. 
"She was a size six, and I must've been size 16 or 20. 
"But she let me come in and try on all of her clothes on, and she gave me a Chanel handbag, shoes, and a little black number. 
"She was a real girl's girl." 
*This Morning continues on ITV1 weekdays at 10.30am Read More
